Interface IClan

public interface IClan
Read-only view of a ProudCore clan.

A clan is a persistent group of players that share a collective identity, territory, and a pool of power. One player holds the role of leader and has exclusive control over administrative operations such as inviting or kicking members and managing territorial claims.

Power system

Every clan has a current total power and a maximum total power. Power is the sum of all members' individual power values (see IPlayerData) and directly limits the number of chunks the clan may claim: if total power drops below the number of existing claims, the server may automatically release excess claims according to its configured policy. Power decreases when members die and recovers passively over time.

Territorial claims

Claimed chunks are Minecraft world chunks "owned" by the clan. The maximum number of claimable chunks is bounded by the clan's total power. The current count of active claims is exposed via getClaimsCount().

Usage example

IClan clan = clanManager.getClan("spartans");
if (clan != null) {
    System.out.println("Leader : " + clan.getLeader());
    System.out.println("Members: " + clan.getMembers().size());
    System.out.printf("Power  : %.1f / %.1f%n",
            clan.getTotalPower(), clan.getTotalMaxPower());
}
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the clan's unique internal name.

      This identifier is set at creation time, is case-sensitive, and cannot be changed afterwards. It is used as the primary key in all manager lookups (e.g. IClanManager.getClan(String)). It does not carry color codes or formatting — for the decorated variant, use getDisplayName().

      Returns:
      the clan's non-null, non-blank internal name

    • getDisplayName

      String getDisplayName()
      Returns the clan's display name, which may contain color codes and formatting.

      The display name is the text shown to players in chat, tablist, or GUIs. It can contain Minecraft legacy color codes (&a, §a, etc.) or MiniMessage tags, depending on the server's chat library. It may differ from the value returned by getName().

      Returns:
      the clan's non-null display name, potentially formatted

    • getDescription

      String getDescription()
      Returns the clan's description (motto or short lore text).

      This field is set by the clan leader and is purely cosmetic. It may be empty but is never null.

      Returns:
      the clan's description; never null, may be empty

    • getLeader

      UUID getLeader()
      Returns the UUID of the clan's current leader.

      The leader always appears in the set returned by getMembers(). There is exactly one leader per clan at any given time.

      Returns:
      the non-null UUID of the clan leader

    • getMembers

      Set<UUID> getMembers()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of all clan members, including the leader.

      The returned Set is immutable: any attempt to add or remove elements will throw UnsupportedOperationException. Membership changes must go through the manager API.

      Returns:
      a non-null, unmodifiable set of every member's UUID

    • isMember

      boolean isMember(UUID uuid)
      Returns true if the given player is a member of this clan.

      This check includes the leader. Equivalent to getMembers().contains(uuid), but may be faster depending on the underlying implementation.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID to test; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the player is a member or the leader, false otherwise

    • isLeader

      boolean isLeader(UUID uuid)
      Returns true if the given player is the leader of this clan.

      Equivalent to getLeader().equals(uuid), provided as a convenience for permission checks.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID to test; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the player is the clan leader, false otherwise

    • getTotalPower

      double getTotalPower()
      Returns the clan's current aggregate power.

      This value is the real-time sum of all members' current power. It is used to determine the maximum number of territorial chunks the clan may hold. The value is always in the range [0, getTotalMaxPower()].

      Returns:
      the clan's current total power; always >= 0
      See Also:
      • getTotalMaxPower()
      • IPlayerData.getPower()

    • getTotalMaxPower

      double getTotalMaxPower()
      Returns the clan's theoretical maximum aggregate power.

      This cap is the sum of all members' individual maximum power values. It grows as new members join (each contributing their own power cap) and shrinks when members leave. The clan's actual power can never exceed this value.

      Returns:
      the clan's total maximum power; always >= 0
      See Also:
      • getTotalPower()
      • IPlayerData.getMaxPower()

    • getClaimsCount

      int getClaimsCount()
      Returns the number of Minecraft chunks currently claimed by this clan.

      Each claimed chunk contributes one unit toward the clan's power consumption. If the current total power drops below this count, the server may automatically release the weakest claims.

      Returns:
      the count of claimed chunks; always >= 0
      See Also:
      • getTotalPower()

    • getHome

      org.bukkit.Location getHome()
      Returns the clan's designated home location, or null if none is set.

      The home is typically set by the clan leader inside claimed territory and serves as a teleportation anchor for all members. The returned Location object is a copy; mutating it has no effect on the stored value.

      Returns:
      the clan home Location, or null if no home has been set
